speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: SCENE II. Friar Laurence's cell.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Enter FRIAR JOHN

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Holy Franciscan friar! brother, ho!

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Enter FRIAR LAURENCE

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: This same should be the voice of Friar John.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Welcome from Mantua: what says Romeo?

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Or, if his mind be writ, give me his letter.

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Going to find a bare-foot brother out

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: One of our order, to associate me,

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Here in this city visiting the sick,

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: And finding him, the searchers of the town,

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Suspecting that we both were in a house

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Where the infectious pestilence did reign,

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Seal'd up the doors, and would not let us forth;

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: So that my speed to Mantua there was stay'd.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Who bare my letter, then, to Romeo?

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: I could not send it,--here it is again,--

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Nor get a messenger to bring it thee,

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: So fearful were they of infection.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Unhappy fortune! by my brotherhood,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: The letter was not nice but full of charge

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Of dear import, and the neglecting it

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: May do much danger. Friar John, go hence;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Get me an iron crow, and bring it straight

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Unto my cell.

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Brother, I'll go and bring it thee.

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Now must I to the monument alone;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Within three hours will fair Juliet wake:

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: She will beshrew me much that Romeo

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Hath had no notice of these accidents;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: But I will write again to Mantua,

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: And keep her at my cell till Romeo come;

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Poor living corse, closed in a dead man's tomb!

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Exit
